New Records: Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran added the second-highest opening stand in T20 World Cup history with 154 runs
Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz made his 76 off 45 balls with four sixes and as many fours
Ibrahim Zadran struck nine fours and a six in his 46-ball 70
Fazalhaq Farooqi took his maiden five-wicket haul in T20Is
Uganda's top scorer Robinson Obuya was caught behind in the same over to hand Farooqi his five-for
Post-Match Reflections: Afghanistan's 183 for 5 was too much for Uganda, who were bowled out for 58 runs in 16 overs
Uganda would, however, take heart from their comeback with the ball
Afghanistan ruined Uganda's introduction to cricket's biggest event
Miscellaneous Highlights: It was a fine comeback from Uganda after they conceded at 10.85 in the first 14 overs
They didn't give away a single boundary in the last six overs of the innings, the first such instance in the T20 World Cup
Others: Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran's partnership was a tough 14th over for Bilal Hassan, who conceded five wides and then was hit for a four off a no-ball
